summary: This bill, S. 2607, introduced by Mr. Rounds in the Senate, aims to prevent the Department of Defense from using funds to alter the responsibilities, authorities, or command structure of the Commander of United States Cyber Command. Specifically, it prohibits the obligation or expenditure of funds in fiscal year 2026 for any changes to the Cyber Command's operational scope or organizational framework from those in place as of June 1, 2025. The bill's stated purpose is 'to prohibit the availability of funds to modify authorities of the Commander of United States Cyber Command, and for other purposes.'
